ygData.subject: Re: fun after 40--how you tell who the kids are
ygData.msgSnippet: Priceless!  I find it amusing to find people s ages out....I ve been surprised many times.  In my guild, for exaple, we have people ranging in age from 18-50+.
ygData.messageBody:
Priceless! I find it amusing to find people's ages out....I've been
surprised many times. In my guild, for exaple, we have people ranging
in age from 18-50+. And we have people in almost all carreer fields.
It was pretty enlightening to find out our ages. LOL. Melissa you go
girl! BTW I'm between 14-30. And I don't think I fit any streotype
8^p

--- Melissa Johnson <mnj_@...> wrote:
> From: Melissa Johnson <mnj_@...>
>
> i know people that fit that descirption very well,
> and are 30+... im 14 btw
>
> >1) Beg for favors all over the zone
> funny ive never done that
>
> >2) twink
> why not? i worked for the stuff
>
> >3) solo power game
> why not, i can kill red and yellow things just me
> and my pet, but group is
> more fun
>
> >4) are on most people's ignore list
> im not rude or mean, and i dont think on very many
> ignore lists, but my own
> ignore list is full and i have to take people off to
> put others on it.
>
> >5) bully other players with their own greediness
> never
>
> >6) brag too much about their race, class, level,
> wealth or items
> only when joking around
>
> >7) answer every question about game secrets with
> shouts across the >zone to
> >show off what they know (and don't know, hehe)
> only when i think i can help someone, try being nice
> for a change
>
> >8) chatter incessantly about inanities
> stop making me use a dictionary :-)
>
> >9) complain the loudest about others not helping
> them
> i never complain unless someon is mean to me
>
> you shouldnt make generalizations... I try to judge
> people by who they are
> and not discriminate
>
>
>
> >From: Nancie Tenery <tenery@...>
> >Reply-To: EQ_women@onelist.com
> >To: "'EQ_women@onelist.com'" <EQ_women@onelist.com>
> >Subject: Re: [EQ_women] fun after 40--how you tell
> who the kids are
> >Date: Mon, 21 Jun 1999 06:54:13 -0400
> >
> >From: Nancie Tenery <tenery@...>
> >
> >As I said before, I am probably one of the oldest
> at 54 women (55 in
> >September) on EQ. I know of one other on Fennin Ro
> who is older than I am
> >and a women in RL. Mature people have a love of
> gaming, too. I get a lot
> >of pleasure from playing any game, puzzle, or
> challenge. I work off
> >aggression with my slashing and hacking, get
> satisfaction in achieving
> >small goals like acquiring items, making skill or
> experience levels and in
> >discovering and exploring the EQ environment.
> >
> >Us old geezers have the time and the patience (and
> the money) for many
> >on-line activities, as well as having highly
> developed computer-related
> >skills. I have found that women have done very
> well in information
> >management/computer science careers and I have been
> involved since the
> >middle 1960's with large corporations on the west
> and east coasts.
> >I am retired now and only do a little consulting to
> keep my skills and
> >marketability up. This leaves me much time for day
> playing and all night
> >sessions, if I want. I am a borderline compulsive
> when I play this game.
> > It is so immersive and addicting. When a good
> group forms, I like to
> >stay
> >together as long as I can for the session and the
> companionship.
> >
> >I played Realm before EQ. But a family member was
> a beta tester for EQ and
> >showed it to me last year. So I was on the
> distribution list for the
> >production software by New Years of this year and
> started playing the first
> >day of production. I have found that my knowledge
> of the game is only now
> >beginning to surpass the beta testers and I am
> considering volunteering for
> >guide duty. I think older women would make
> excellent guides. If anything,
> >age teaches patience, wit, skin thickening and a
> little teaching skills,
> >which I think are essential attributes for a good
> guide.
> >
> >I can always spot the youngest players. They are
> the ones always shouting
> >for help with corpse retrieval, free food, free
> items, screaming 'gimme,
> >gimme, gimme'. They can't seem to stand
> still.......ever. They never
> >bother with Sense Heading skill development, never
> learned the value of
> >saving up their coins for something they want, and
> seem very self-centered
> >in every thing they do.
> >
> >So, here is a new mail list thread idea:
> >
> >You can always spot the kids when they
> >
> >1) Beg for favors all over the zone
> >2) twink
> >3) solo power game
> >4) are on most people's ignore list
> >5) bully other players with their own greediness
> >6) brag too much about their race, class, level,
> wealth or items
> >7) answer every question about game secrets with
> shouts across the zone to
> >show off what they know (and don't know, hehe)
> >8) chatter incessantly about inanities
> >9) complain the loudest about others not helping
> them
> >10) ..................[you fill in your favorite
> here]
> >
> >
> >Dornar and Dornita
> >
> >
> >
> >-----Original Message-----
> >From: Beth Moursund [SMTP:scrybsprite@...]
> >Sent: Sunday, June 20, 1999 1:29 PM
> >To: 'eq_women@onelist.com'
> >Subject: Re: [EQ_women] fun after 40
> >
> >From: Beth Moursund <scrybsprite@...>
> >
> >Janice writes:
> > >By the way, regarding the subject of "older
> women" playing EQ, I bet I am
> > >one of oldest. I will be 49 next month. Not
> that it matters. Maybe it
> > >will give some of you young gals hope that there
> IS fun after 40. Boy,
> >is
> > >there ever fun after 40.
> >
> >That's great! You're certainly on the tip of the
> demographic curve for
> >computer games. How did you happen to start
> playing Everquest?
> >
> >By the way, I'm 35. My mother is over 60, and she
> plays some computer
> >games. She has a Macintosh, though, so I can't
> introduce her to Everquest.
> >
> > - Beth "BethMo" Moursund
> > Windsong Wanderer on Solusek Ro
> >
> >
> >
>
